name: Capt Hiram's Resort

reviews.text: The room was clean and the view from my riverside accommodation (most expensive room) was all right. That's the good part. The included breakfast was simply minimal and the front desk staff were clueless and not resourceful about the area. And by the way, there is not much going on in the area....their restaurant is pedestrian.
reviews.title: Find accomodations elsewhere!

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the Inn it look very attractive on the outside. The check-in staff was pleasant. The Inn on the inside had recently been repainted and odors of the paint still lingered. The room was nicely decorated. The problem began when you wanted to go to sleep. The mattress was as hard as a rock and very uncomfortable. The walls were paper thin so you could here everyone coming and going down the hall as well as people outside by the pool. We were on the third floor and there were people partying down by the pool and you could hear every word they said from our room. Across the street from the Inn is the Inn's Bar and Restaurant. They had a band playing and we heard it all night long until they shut down. We didn't have to stay over there to hear them we could have partied in our room to the music it was so loud. Upon checking out I told the clerk about the noise and he had to response, just handed me a copy of my bill and sent me on my way. I would not recommend this Inn to anyone that want's to get some sleep at night.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Sebastian

likes.liked: — The view from the restaurant across the street
likes.disliked: — The noise coming from the restaurant/bar across the street

reviews.text: I went and stayed at Capt. HIrams Key West Inn for my birthday with a group of friends. What started out as a great vacation turned out to be anything other than. When I booked the room it was supposed to be a Queen mini, whole reason was because it had two beds and a fold out couch. Fold out couch was completly destroyed and couldn't get another room or another couch or a fold out cot. Was pretty much told sorry about you luck. Also complained about our air which never work right the whole time we were there. They did send someone out to fix it but never fixed it. Problem with air never resolved. Front desk and/or managers where not willing to help us or even cared to help us. Pretty much some of the ruddest people I have ever dealt with. Problems continue over at the Sand Bar because everyone was rude and didn't really care to help you are care that you were even there. Point being this place is a tourist trap. They take your money and then treat you like crap. Not the place to stay if you want good service.
reviews.title: Tourist trap
Captain Hiram's parking fiasco
reviews.text: I stayed at Captain Hiram's while our swim team from Palm Beach was competing at a meet close to the resort. When I first arrived in the evening, I couldn't park at all. It seems that the waterfront dining customers take priority over the people who are attempting to park at the resort in order to sleep/rest. We (many people in the same boat) were instructed to park at the check in swale and then return later to park the car in a parking space. The same thing happened on the following night. The room and area were excellent, but if you stay, park before 4 and don't plan to go anywhere if you wish to return before 8, unless they have corrected this fiasco.

We just got home from a 3 night stay at Captain Hiram's Key West Inn. We were there over Memorial Weekend. We traveled as a family with 2 teens. We also brought our boat & used the marina at the hotel.
reviews.title: Getaway close to home

likes.disliked: — Lack of Service by Bartenders and some Wait Staff

reviews.title: Great Stay at Key West Inn Sebastian, FL
reviews.text: This is the hotel that is part of the Captian Hiriam's Resort. They have everything right there, a pool, a restaurant and a marina with a great River Boat Cruise. We did it all and had a great spring break. Not at all run over with spring breakers but enough to make it fun. At night they have a band at the Sandbar. Check out their web site which is what we did and it was exactly the way they said it was. Gotta' go to Sebastian Inlet and the trip is complete.

reviews.title: best around!
reviews.text: we found everything to be "the best" clean,charming rooms-wonderful breakfast bar,really fun restaurant with sea worthy atmosphere, hotel help absolutely excellent..very friendly and go out of their way to accomodate.We highly reccomend ----thanks!

reviews.title: Try this place
reviews.text: Great location, fabulous atmosphere and the restaurant food was superb.

This is also known as Key West Inn. This was our second trip to this location for spring break. Our first trip we stayed pool side with a patio. This trip we were river side with a balcony. Yes, the walls were thinner river side. But little much else to complain about. After we left here we ended up paying $200 a night in Melbourne Beach just north of Sebastian and got half the room with no breakfast included. We felt so at home here at Captain Hiram's. After dinner we went for a walk each night and felt safe with a lot of people doing the same thing. I recommend for breakfast Country Ham and Eggs restaurant on US 1 if you want a change from the continental breakfast at the Inn. Even if you have to wait it goes quickly and they even have a coffee pot for you while you wait. Also recommend Vic's Italian Restaurant, I think it's on Washington and US 1. As always the trip has to be a part of going to the Inlet of Sebastian. Great beach for every age .
reviews.title: Another great stay
Can't wait to come back and stay longer
reviews.text: After reading several reviews, we took a chance and booked this. One review in particular was pretty awful, and we were a bit nervous. Upon arrival, we're wondering where that person actually stayed! Our visit has been spectacular from registration through check-out. Rooms are large and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room was very clean. We haven't gone down for breakfast yet, but I did read that it even includes breakfast meats - something most hotels do not do.
In addition, the inn is within walking distance of Captain Hiram's Restaurant (right on the intracoastal and one of our favorites) and Captain Hiram's Sand Bar.
reviews.title: Fun and relaxing weekend

likes.liked: — Easy access to fun bar and restaurant area
likes.disliked: — Pool area didn't have good lounges.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please don't hesitate to stay here.
reviews.title: Great start to our holiday
Walk the Plank and Run!
reviews.text: This was a great choice for a "Girl's weekend." The motel is part of a property which also includes a riverside bar and restaurant area. The motel is very nice, rooms modern, spacious and clean. Only about 14 have waterfront views, the many others face parking lots, but the balconies look down on lots of greenery, it wasn't bad. Our building was 3 stories, with an elevator. The halls got a little noisy late at night as weekend partiers returned to their rooms, but that's what these weekends are for.

reviews.title: Best of Sebastian
reviews.text: I used to live in Sebastian but now when I return I stay at the Key West Inn. I was already familiar with them as I often referred customers to the resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, the staff helpful, and everything you need is there.
reviews.title: Key West without the long drive

reviews.text: Their restaurant (Capt. Hiram's) across the street offers good seafood either inside or their lighter fare can be eaten at the Sand Bar. The back of the restaurant and the Sand Bar overlook the gorgeous Indian River near the Sebastian Inlet. Manatees, dolphins and once in a while a shark can be seen passing by.
reviews.title: Loved Hiram's

likes.disliked: — Resort a bit quiet outside of accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is musical entertainment most evenings - sometimes several different venues to choose from. They have smaller, more acoustic or older style musicians playing indoors and at the smaller stage outside or on weekends they often have rock bands.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Someone in another review noted something about not too many spring breakers but just enough to be fun. Most likely they confused Spring Breakers with the local skydivers. The restaurant is a favorite after jumping hang out for both the local jumpers and the many jumpers that flock to Sebastian from all over the world for the fantastic view of the Treasure Coast from the air.
reviews.title: Fun Tropical Style Resort

description: Capt Hiram's is located on the beautiful Intracoastal Waterway of Sebastian FL. This Key West Style resort offers seventy hotel rooms ranging from standard king and double queen rooms to river view mini suites and Jacuzzi rooms. This beautiful facility is designed to appeal to weekend travelers, fishermen, business travelers and long term guests. All of our smoke free rooms have private balconies, Wireless internet access, voice mail, and a deluxe continental breakfast. Hot breakfast available on weekends! Be sure and visit our adventure center, go biking, kayaking, paddleboarding, or even Para-Sailing!
